get.description: Returns a list of all buckets owned by the authenticated sender of the request.

delete.description: Deletes the bucket. All objects (including all object versions and Delete Markers) in the bucket must be deleted before the bucket itself can be deleted.

get.description: Returns some or all (up to 1000) of the objects in a bucket. You can use the request parameters as selection criteria to return a subset of the objects in a bucket.

parameters.description: A delimiter is a character you use to group keys.
parameters.name: delimiter

parameters.description: Requests Amazon S3 to encode the object keys in the response and specifies the encoding method to use. An object key may contain any Unicode character; however, XML 1.0 parser cannot parse some characters, such as characters with an ASCII value from 0 to 10. For characters that are not supported in XML 1.0, you can add this parameter to request that Amazon S3 encode the keys in the response.
parameters.name: encoding-type

parameters.description: Specifies the key to start with when listing objects in a bucket.
parameters.name: marker

parameters.description: Sets the maximum number of keys returned in the response. The response might contain fewer keys but will never contain more.
parameters.name: max-keys

parameters.description: Limits the response to keys that begin with the specified prefix.
parameters.name: prefix

parameters.description: Confirms that the requester knows that she or he will be charged for the request. Bucket owners need not specify this parameter in their requests. Documentation on downloading objects from requester pays buckets can be found at http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonS3/latest/dev/ObjectsinRequesterPaysBuckets.html
parameters.name: x-amz-request-payer

parameters.description: Pagination limit
parameters.name: MaxKeys

parameters.description: Pagination token
parameters.name: Marker

head.description: This operation is useful to determine if a bucket exists and you have permission to access it.

put.description: Creates a new bucket.

parameters.description: The canned ACL to apply to the bucket.
parameters.name: x-amz-acl

parameters.description: Allows grantee the read, write, read ACP, and write ACP permissions on the bucket.
parameters.name: x-amz-grant-full-control

parameters.description: Allows grantee to list the objects in the bucket.
parameters.name: x-amz-grant-read

parameters.description: Allows grantee to read the bucket ACL.
parameters.name: x-amz-grant-read-acp

parameters.description: Allows grantee to create, overwrite, and delete any object in the bucket.
parameters.name: x-amz-grant-write

parameters.description: Allows grantee to write the ACL for the applicable bucket.
parameters.name: x-amz-grant-write-acp

parameters.description: Specifies whether you want Amazon S3 object lock to be enabled for the new bucket.
parameters.name: x-amz-bucket-object-lock-enabled

get.description: Returns the accelerate configuration of a bucket.

parameters.description: Name of the bucket for which the accelerate configuration is retrieved.
parameters.name: Bucket

put.description: Sets the accelerate configuration of an existing bucket.

parameters.description: Name of the bucket for which the accelerate configuration is set.
parameters.name: Bucket

AccelerateConfiguration.description: Configures the transfer acceleration state for an Amazon S3 bucket. For more information, see Amazon S3 Transfer Acceleration in the Amazon Simple Storage Service Developer Guide.

get.description: Gets the access control policy for the bucket.

put.description: Sets the permissions on a bucket using access control lists (ACL).

parameters.description: The canned ACL to apply to the bucket.
parameters.name: x-amz-acl

parameters.description: Allows grantee the read, write, read ACP, and write ACP permissions on the bucket.
parameters.name: x-amz-grant-full-control

parameters.description: Allows grantee to list the objects in the bucket.
parameters.name: x-amz-grant-read

parameters.description: Allows grantee to read the bucket ACL.
parameters.name: x-amz-grant-read-acp

parameters.description: Allows grantee to create, overwrite, and delete any object in the bucket.
parameters.name: x-amz-grant-write

parameters.description: Allows grantee to write the ACL for the applicable bucket.
parameters.name: x-amz-grant-write-acp

get.description: Lists the analytics configurations for the bucket.

parameters.description: The name of the bucket from which analytics configurations are retrieved.
parameters.name: Bucket

parameters.description: The ContinuationToken that represents a placeholder from where this request should begin.
parameters.name: continuation-token

delete.description:
Deletes an analytics configuration for the bucket (specified by the analytics configuration ID).

To use this operation, you must have permissions to perform the s3:PutAnalyticsConfiguration action. The bucket owner has this permission by default. The bucket owner can grant this permission to others.

parameters.description: The name of the bucket from which an analytics configuration is deleted.
parameters.name: Bucket

parameters.description: The ID that identifies the analytics configuration.
parameters.name: id

get.description: Gets an analytics configuration for the bucket (specified by the analytics configuration ID).

parameters.description: The name of the bucket from which an analytics configuration is retrieved.
parameters.name: Bucket

parameters.description: The ID that identifies the analytics configuration.
parameters.name: id

put.description: Sets an analytics configuration for the bucket (specified by the analytics configuration ID).

parameters.description: The name of the bucket to which an analytics configuration is stored.
parameters.name: Bucket

parameters.description: The ID that identifies the analytics configuration.
parameters.name: id

AnalyticsConfiguration.description:
Specifies the configuration and any analyses for the analytics filter of an Amazon S3 bucket.

For more information, see GET Bucket analytics in the Amazon Simple Storage Service API Reference.

delete.description: Deletes the CORS configuration information set for the bucket.

get.description: Returns the CORS configuration for the bucket.

put.description: Sets the CORS configuration for a bucket.

CORSConfiguration.description: Describes the cross-origin access configuration for objects in an Amazon S3 bucket. For more information, see Enabling Cross-Origin Resource Sharing in the Amazon Simple Storage Service Developer Guide.

post.description: This operation enables you to delete multiple objects from a bucket using a single HTTP request. You may specify up to 1000 keys.

parameters.description: The concatenation of the authentication device's serial number, a space, and the value that is displayed on your authentication device.
parameters.name: x-amz-mfa

parameters.description: Confirms that the requester knows that she or he will be charged for the request. Bucket owners need not specify this parameter in their requests. Documentation on downloading objects from requester pays buckets can be found at http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonS3/latest/dev/ObjectsinRequesterPaysBuckets.html
parameters.name: x-amz-request-payer

parameters.description: Specifies whether you want to delete this object even if it has a Governance-type object lock in place. You must have sufficient permissions to perform this operation.
parameters.name: x-amz-bypass-governance-retention

delete.description: Deletes the server-side encryption configuration from the bucket.

parameters.description: The name of the bucket containing the server-side encryption configuration to delete.
parameters.name: Bucket

get.description: Returns the server-side encryption configuration of a bucket.

parameters.description: The name of the bucket from which the server-side encryption configuration is retrieved.
parameters.name: Bucket

put.description: Creates a new server-side encryption configuration (or replaces an existing one, if present).

parameters.description: Specifies default encryption for a bucket using server-side encryption with Amazon S3-managed keys (SSE-S3) or AWS KMS-managed keys (SSE-KMS). For information about the Amazon S3 default encryption feature, see Amazon S3 Default Bucket Encryption in the Amazon Simple Storage Service Developer Guide.
parameters.name: Bucket

parameters.description: The base64-encoded 128-bit MD5 digest of the server-side encryption configuration. This parameter is auto-populated when using the command from the CLI.
parameters.name: Content-MD5

get.description: Returns a list of inventory configurations for the bucket.

parameters.description: The name of the bucket containing the inventory configurations to retrieve.
parameters.name: Bucket

parameters.description: The marker used to continue an inventory configuration listing that has been truncated. Use the NextContinuationToken from a previously truncated list response to continue the listing. The continuation token is an opaque value that Amazon S3 understands.
parameters.name: continuation-token

delete.description: Deletes an inventory configuration (identified by the inventory ID) from the bucket.

parameters.description: The name of the bucket containing the inventory configuration to delete.
parameters.name: Bucket

parameters.description: The ID used to identify the inventory configuration.
parameters.name: id

get.description: Returns an inventory configuration (identified by the inventory ID) from the bucket.

parameters.description: The name of the bucket containing the inventory configuration to retrieve.
parameters.name: Bucket

parameters.description: The ID used to identify the inventory configuration.
parameters.name: id

put.description: Adds an inventory configuration (identified by the inventory ID) from the bucket.

parameters.description: The name of the bucket where the inventory configuration will be stored.
parameters.name: Bucket

parameters.description: The ID used to identify the inventory configuration.
parameters.name: id

InventoryConfiguration.description: Specifies the inventory configuration for an Amazon S3 bucket. For more information, see GET Bucket inventory in the Amazon Simple Storage Service API Reference.

delete.description: Deletes the lifecycle configuration from the bucket.

get.description: Returns the lifecycle configuration information set on the bucket.

put.description: Sets lifecycle configuration for your bucket. If a lifecycle configuration exists, it replaces it.

LifecycleConfiguration.description: Specifies the lifecycle configuration for objects in an Amazon S3 bucket. For more information, see Object Lifecycle Management in the Amazon Simple Storage Service Developer Guide.

get.description: No longer used, see the GetBucketLifecycleConfiguration operation.

put.description: No longer used, see the PutBucketLifecycleConfiguration operation.

get.description: Returns some or all (up to 1000) of the objects in a bucket. You can use the request parameters as selection criteria to return a subset of the objects in a bucket. Note: ListObjectsV2 is the revised List Objects API and we recommend you use this revised API for new application development.

parameters.description: Name of the bucket to list.
parameters.name: Bucket

parameters.description: A delimiter is a character you use to group keys.
parameters.name: delimiter

parameters.description: Requests Amazon S3 to encode the object keys in the response and specifies the encoding method to use. An object key may contain any Unicode character; however, XML 1.0 parser cannot parse some characters, such as characters with an ASCII value from 0 to 10. For characters that are not supported in XML 1.0, you can add this parameter to request that Amazon S3 encode the keys in the response.
parameters.name: encoding-type

parameters.description: Sets the maximum number of keys returned in the response. The response might contain fewer keys but will never contain more.
parameters.name: max-keys

parameters.description: Limits the response to keys that begin with the specified prefix.
parameters.name: prefix

parameters.description: ContinuationToken indicates Amazon S3 that the list is being continued on this bucket with a token. ContinuationToken is obfuscated and is not a real key
parameters.name: continuation-token

parameters.description: The owner field is not present in listV2 by default, if you want to return owner field with each key in the result then set the fetch owner field to true
parameters.name: fetch-owner

parameters.description: StartAfter is where you want Amazon S3 to start listing from. Amazon S3 starts listing after this specified key. StartAfter can be any key in the bucket
parameters.name: start-after

parameters.description: Confirms that the requester knows that she or he will be charged for the request. Bucket owners need not specify this parameter in their requests. Documentation on downloading objects from requester pays buckets can be found at http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonS3/latest/dev/ObjectsinRequesterPaysBuckets.html
parameters.name: x-amz-request-payer

parameters.description: Pagination limit
parameters.name: MaxKeys

parameters.description: Pagination token
parameters.name: ContinuationToken

get.description: Returns the region the bucket resides in.
Returns the logging status of a bucket and the permissions users have to view and modify that status. To use GET, you must be the bucket owner.

put.description: Set the logging parameters for a bucket and to specify permissions for who can view and modify the logging parameters. To set the logging status of a bucket, you must be the bucket owner.

get.description: Lists the metrics configurations for the bucket.

parameters.description: The name of the bucket containing the metrics configurations to retrieve.
parameters.name: Bucket

parameters.description: The marker that is used to continue a metrics configuration listing that has been truncated. Use the NextContinuationToken from a previously truncated list response to continue the listing. The continuation token is an opaque value that Amazon S3 understands.
parameters.name: continuation-token

delete.description: Deletes a metrics configuration (specified by the metrics configuration ID) from the bucket.

parameters.description: The name of the bucket containing the metrics configuration to delete.
parameters.name: Bucket

parameters.description: The ID used to identify the metrics configuration.
parameters.name: id

get.description: Gets a metrics configuration (specified by the metrics configuration ID) from the bucket.

parameters.description: The name of the bucket containing the metrics configuration to retrieve.
parameters.name: Bucket

parameters.description: The ID used to identify the metrics configuration.
parameters.name: id

put.description: Sets a metrics configuration (specified by the metrics configuration ID) for the bucket.

parameters.description: The name of the bucket for which the metrics configuration is set.
parameters.name: Bucket

parameters.description: The ID used to identify the metrics configuration.
parameters.name: id

MetricsConfiguration.description: Specifies a metrics configuration for the CloudWatch request metrics (specified by the metrics configuration ID) from an Amazon S3 bucket. If you're updating an existing metrics configuration, note that this is a full replacement of the existing metrics configuration. If you don't include the elements you want to keep, they are erased. For more information, see PUT Bucket metrics in the Amazon Simple Storage Service API Reference.

get.description: Returns the notification configuration of a bucket.

parameters.description: Name of the bucket to get the notification configuration for.
parameters.name: Bucket

put.description: Enables notifications of specified events for a bucket.

NotificationConfiguration.description: A container for specifying the notification configuration of the bucket. If this element is empty, notifications are turned off for the bucket.

get.description: No longer used, see the GetBucketNotificationConfiguration operation.

parameters.description: Name of the bucket to get the notification configuration for.
parameters.name: Bucket

put.description: No longer used, see the PutBucketNotificationConfiguration operation.

get.description: Gets the object lock configuration for a bucket. The rule specified in the object lock configuration will be applied by default to every new object placed in the specified bucket.

parameters.description: The bucket whose object lock configuration you want to retrieve.
parameters.name: Bucket

put.description: Places an object lock configuration on the specified bucket. The rule specified in the object lock configuration will be applied by default to every new object placed in the specified bucket.

parameters.description: The bucket whose object lock configuration you want to create or replace.
parameters.name: Bucket

parameters.description: Confirms that the requester knows that she or he will be charged for the request. Bucket owners need not specify this parameter in their requests. Documentation on downloading objects from requester pays buckets can be found at http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonS3/latest/dev/ObjectsinRequesterPaysBuckets.html
parameters.name: x-amz-request-payer

parameters.description: A token to allow Amazon S3 object lock to be enabled for an existing bucket.
parameters.name: x-amz-bucket-object-lock-token

parameters.description: The MD5 hash for the request body.
parameters.name: Content-MD5

ObjectLockConfiguration.description: The container element for object lock configuration parameters.

delete.description: Deletes the policy from the bucket.

get.description: Returns the policy of a specified bucket.

put.description: Applies an Amazon S3 bucket policy to an Amazon S3 bucket.

parameters.description: Set this parameter to true to confirm that you want to remove your permissions to change this bucket policy in the future.
parameters.name: x-amz-confirm-remove-self-bucket-access

Policy.description: The bucket policy as a JSON document.

get.description: Retrieves the policy status for an Amazon S3 bucket, indicating whether the bucket is public.

parameters.description: The name of the Amazon S3 bucket whose policy status you want to retrieve.
parameters.name: Bucket

delete.description: Removes the PublicAccessBlock configuration from an Amazon S3 bucket.

parameters.description: The Amazon S3 bucket whose PublicAccessBlock configuration you want to delete.
parameters.name: Bucket

get.description: Retrieves the PublicAccessBlock configuration for an Amazon S3 bucket.

parameters.description: The name of the Amazon S3 bucket whose PublicAccessBlock configuration you want to retrieve.
parameters.name: Bucket

put.description: Creates or modifies the PublicAccessBlock configuration for an Amazon S3 bucket.

parameters.description: The name of the Amazon S3 bucket whose PublicAccessBlock configuration you want to set.
parameters.name: Bucket

parameters.description: The MD5 hash of the PutPublicAccessBlock request body.
parameters.name: Content-MD5

PublicAccessBlockConfiguration.description: Specifies the Block Public Access configuration for an Amazon S3 bucket.

delete.description: Deletes the replication configuration from the bucket. For information about replication configuration, see Cross-Region Replication (CRR) in the Amazon S3 Developer Guide.

parameters.description:
The bucket name.

It can take a while to propagate the deletion of a replication configuration to all Amazon S3 systems.
parameters.name: Bucket

get.description:
Returns the replication configuration of a bucket.

It can take a while to propagate the put or delete a replication configuration to all Amazon S3 systems. Therefore, a get request soon after put or delete can return a wrong result.

put.description: Creates a replication configuration or replaces an existing one. For more information, see Cross-Region Replication (CRR) in the Amazon S3 Developer Guide.

parameters.description: The base64-encoded 128-bit MD5 digest of the data. You must use this header as a message integrity check to verify that the request body was not corrupted in transit.
parameters.name: Content-MD5

parameters.description: A token that allows Amazon S3 object lock to be enabled for an existing bucket.
parameters.name: x-amz-bucket-object-lock-token

ReplicationConfiguration.description: A container for replication rules. You can add up to 1,000 rules. The maximum size of a replication configuration is 2 MB.

get.description: Returns the request payment configuration of a bucket.

put.description: Sets the request payment configuration for a bucket. By default, the bucket owner pays for downloads from the bucket. This configuration parameter enables the bucket owner (only) to specify that the person requesting the download will be charged for the download. Documentation on requester pays buckets can be found at http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonS3/latest/dev/RequesterPaysBuckets.html

delete.description: Deletes the tags from the bucket.

get.description: Returns the tag set associated with the bucket.

put.description: Sets the tags for a bucket.

get.description: This operation lists in-progress multipart uploads.

parameters.description: Character you use to group keys.
parameters.name: delimiter

parameters.description: Requests Amazon S3 to encode the object keys in the response and specifies the encoding method to use. An object key may contain any Unicode character; however, XML 1.0 parser cannot parse some characters, such as characters with an ASCII value from 0 to 10. For characters that are not supported in XML 1.0, you can add this parameter to request that Amazon S3 encode the keys in the response.
parameters.name: encoding-type

parameters.description: Together with upload-id-marker, this parameter specifies the multipart upload after which listing should begin.
parameters.name: key-marker

parameters.description: Sets the maximum number of multipart uploads, from 1 to 1,000, to return in the response body. 1,000 is the maximum number of uploads that can be returned in a response.
parameters.name: max-uploads

parameters.description: Lists in-progress uploads only for those keys that begin with the specified prefix.
parameters.name: prefix

parameters.description: Together with key-marker, specifies the multipart upload after which listing should begin. If key-marker is not specified, the upload-id-marker parameter is ignored.
parameters.name: upload-id-marker

parameters.description: Pagination limit
parameters.name: MaxUploads

parameters.description: Pagination token
parameters.name: KeyMarker

parameters.description: Pagination token
parameters.name: UploadIdMarker

get.description: Returns the versioning state of a bucket.

put.description: Sets the versioning state of an existing bucket. To set the versioning state, you must be the bucket owner.

parameters.description: The concatenation of the authentication device's serial number, a space, and the value that is displayed on your authentication device.
parameters.name: x-amz-mfa

VersioningConfiguration.description: Describes the versioning state of an Amazon S3 bucket. For more information, see PUT Bucket versioning in the Amazon Simple Storage Service API Reference.

get.description: Returns metadata about all of the versions of objects in a bucket.

parameters.description: A delimiter is a character you use to group keys.

parameters.description: Requests Amazon S3 to encode the object keys in the response and specifies the encoding method to use. An object key may contain any Unicode character; however, XML 1.0 parser cannot parse some characters, such as characters with an ASCII value from 0 to 10. For characters that are not supported in XML 1.0, you can add this parameter to request that Amazon S3 encode the keys in the response.
parameters.name: encoding-type

parameters.description: Specifies the key to start with when listing objects in a bucket.
parameters.name: key-marker

parameters.description: Sets the maximum number of keys returned in the response. The response might contain fewer keys but will never contain more.
parameters.name: max-keys

parameters.description: Limits the response to keys that begin with the specified prefix.
parameters.name: prefix

parameters.description: Specifies the object version you want to start listing from.
parameters.name: version-id-marker

parameters.description: Pagination limit
parameters.name: MaxKeys

parameters.description: Pagination token
parameters.name: KeyMarker

parameters.description: Pagination token

delete.description: This operation removes the website configuration from the bucket.

get.description: Returns the website configuration for a bucket.

put.description: Set the website configuration for a bucket.

WebsiteConfiguration.description: Specifies website configuration parameters for an Amazon S3 bucket.

delete.description: Removes the null version (if there is one) of an object and inserts a delete marker, which becomes the latest version of the object. If there isn't a null version, Amazon S3 does not remove any objects.

parameters.description: The concatenation of the authentication device's serial number, a space, and the value that is displayed on your authentication device.
parameters.name: x-amz-mfa

parameters.description: VersionId used to reference a specific version of the object.
parameters.name: versionId

parameters.description: Confirms that the requester knows that she or he will be charged for the request. Bucket owners need not specify this parameter in their requests. Documentation on downloading objects from requester pays buckets can be found at http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonS3/latest/dev/ObjectsinRequesterPaysBuckets.html
parameters.name: x-amz-request-payer

parameters.description: Indicates whether Amazon S3 object lock should bypass governance-mode restrictions to process this operation.
parameters.name: x-amz-bypass-governance-retention

get.description: Retrieves objects from Amazon S3.

parameters.description: Return the object only if its entity tag (ETag) is the same as the one specified, otherwise return a 412 (precondition failed).
parameters.name: If-Match

parameters.description: Return the object only if it has been modified since the specified time, otherwise return a 304 (not modified).
parameters.name: If-Modified-Since

parameters.description: Return the object only if its entity tag (ETag) is different from the one specified, otherwise return a 304 (not modified).
parameters.name: If-None-Match

parameters.description: Return the object only if it has not been modified since the specified time, otherwise return a 412 (precondition failed).
parameters.name: If-Unmodified-Since

parameters.description: Downloads the specified range bytes of an object. For more information about the HTTP Range header, go to http://www.w3.org/Protocols/rfc2616/rfc2616-sec14.html#sec14.35.
parameters.name: Range

parameters.description: Sets the Cache-Control header of the response.
parameters.name: response-cache-control

parameters.description: Sets the Content-Disposition header of the response
parameters.name: response-content-disposition

parameters.description: Sets the Content-Encoding header of the response.
parameters.name: response-content-encoding

parameters.description: Sets the Content-Language header of the response.
parameters.name: response-content-language

parameters.description: Sets the Content-Type header of the response.
parameters.name: response-content-type

parameters.description: Sets the Expires header of the response.
parameters.name: response-expires

parameters.description: VersionId used to reference a specific version of the object.
parameters.name: versionId

parameters.description: Specifies the algorithm to use to when encrypting the object (e.g., AES256).
parameters.name: x-amz-server-side-encryption-customer-algorithm

parameters.description: Specifies the customer-provided encryption key for Amazon S3 to use in encrypting data. This value is used to store the object and then it is discarded; Amazon does not store the encryption key. The key must be appropriate for use with the algorithm specified in the x-amz-server-side​-encryption​-customer-algorithm header.
parameters.name: x-amz-server-side-encryption-customer-key

parameters.description: Specifies the 128-bit MD5 digest of the encryption key according to RFC 1321. Amazon S3 uses this header for a message integrity check to ensure the encryption key was transmitted without error.
parameters.name: x-amz-server-side-encryption-customer-key-MD5

parameters.description: Confirms that the requester knows that she or he will be charged for the request. Bucket owners need not specify this parameter in their requests. Documentation on downloading objects from requester pays buckets can be found at http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonS3/latest/dev/ObjectsinRequesterPaysBuckets.html
parameters.name: x-amz-request-payer

parameters.description: Part number of the object being read. This is a positive integer between 1 and 10,000. Effectively performs a 'ranged' GET request for the part specified. Useful for downloading just a part of an object.
parameters.name: partNumber

head.description: The HEAD operation retrieves metadata from an object without returning the object itself. This operation is useful if you're only interested in an object's metadata. To use HEAD, you must have READ access to the object.

parameters.description: Return the object only if its entity tag (ETag) is the same as the one specified, otherwise return a 412 (precondition failed).

parameters.description: Return the object only if it has been modified since the specified time, otherwise return a 304 (not modified).
parameters.name: If-Modified-Since

parameters.description: Return the object only if its entity tag (ETag) is different from the one specified, otherwise return a 304 (not modified).
parameters.name: If-None-Match

parameters.description: Return the object only if it has not been modified since the specified time, otherwise return a 412 (precondition failed).
parameters.name: If-Unmodified-Since

parameters.description: Downloads the specified range bytes of an object. For more information about the HTTP Range header, go to http://www.w3.org/Protocols/rfc2616/rfc2616-sec14.html#sec14.35.
parameters.name: Range

parameters.description: VersionId used to reference a specific version of the object.
parameters.name: versionId

parameters.description: Specifies the algorithm to use to when encrypting the object (e.g., AES256).
parameters.name: x-amz-server-side-encryption-customer-algorithm

parameters.description: Specifies the customer-provided encryption key for Amazon S3 to use in encrypting data. This value is used to store the object and then it is discarded; Amazon does not store the encryption key. The key must be appropriate for use with the algorithm specified in the x-amz-server-side​-encryption​-customer-algorithm header.
parameters.name: x-amz-server-side-encryption-customer-key

parameters.description: Specifies the 128-bit MD5 digest of the encryption key according to RFC 1321. Amazon S3 uses this header for a message integrity check to ensure the encryption key was transmitted without error.
parameters.name: x-amz-server-side-encryption-customer-key-MD5

parameters.description: Confirms that the requester knows that she or he will be charged for the request. Bucket owners need not specify this parameter in their requests. Documentation on downloading objects from requester pays buckets can be found at http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonS3/latest/dev/ObjectsinRequesterPaysBuckets.html
parameters.name: x-amz-request-payer

parameters.description: Part number of the object being read. This is a positive integer between 1 and 10,000. Effectively performs a 'ranged' HEAD request for the part specified. Useful querying about the size of the part and the number of parts in this object.
parameters.name: partNumber

put.description: Adds an object to a bucket.

parameters.description: The canned ACL to apply to the object.
parameters.name: x-amz-acl

parameters.description: Name of the bucket to which the PUT operation was initiated.
parameters.name: Bucket

parameters.description: Specifies caching behavior along the request/reply chain.
parameters.name: Cache-Control

parameters.description: Specifies presentational information for the object.
parameters.name: Content-Disposition

parameters.description: Specifies what content encodings have been applied to the object and thus what decoding mechanisms must be applied to obtain the media-type referenced by the Content-Type header field.
parameters.name: Content-Encoding

parameters.description: The language the content is in.
parameters.name: Content-Language

parameters.description: Size of the body in bytes. This parameter is useful when the size of the body cannot be determined automatically.
parameters.name: Content-Length

parameters.description: The base64-encoded 128-bit MD5 digest of the part data. This parameter is auto-populated when using the command from the CLI. This parameted is required if object lock parameters are specified.
parameters.name: Content-MD5

parameters.description: A standard MIME type describing the format of the object data.
parameters.name: Content-Type

parameters.description: The date and time at which the object is no longer cacheable.
parameters.name: Expires

parameters.description: Gives the grantee READ, READ_ACP, and WRITE_ACP permissions on the object.
parameters.name: x-amz-grant-full-control

parameters.description: Allows grantee to read the object data and its metadata.
parameters.name: x-amz-grant-read

parameters.description: Allows grantee to read the object ACL.
parameters.name: x-amz-grant-read-acp

parameters.description: Allows grantee to write the ACL for the applicable object.
parameters.name: x-amz-grant-write-acp

parameters.description: Object key for which the PUT operation was initiated.
parameters.name: Key

parameters.description: The Server-side encryption algorithm used when storing this object in S3 (e.g., AES256, aws:kms).
parameters.name: x-amz-server-side-encryption

parameters.description: The type of storage to use for the object. Defaults to 'STANDARD'.
parameters.name: x-amz-storage-class

parameters.description: If the bucket is configured as a website, redirects requests for this object to another object in the same bucket or to an external URL. Amazon S3 stores the value of this header in the object metadata.

parameters.description: Specifies the algorithm to use to when encrypting the object (e.g., AES256).
parameters.name: x-amz-server-side-encryption-customer-algorithm

parameters.description: Specifies the customer-provided encryption key for Amazon S3 to use in encrypting data. This value is used to store the object and then it is discarded; Amazon does not store the encryption key. The key must be appropriate for use with the algorithm specified in the x-amz-server-side​-encryption​-customer-algorithm header.
parameters.name: x-amz-server-side-encryption-customer-key

parameters.description: Specifies the 128-bit MD5 digest of the encryption key according to RFC 1321. Amazon S3 uses this header for a message integrity check to ensure the encryption key was transmitted without error.
parameters.name: x-amz-server-side-encryption-customer-key-MD5

parameters.description: Specifies the AWS KMS key ID to use for object encryption. All GET and PUT requests for an object protected by AWS KMS will fail if not made via SSL or using SigV4. parameters.description: Specifies the AWS KMS Encryption Context to use for object encryption. The value of this header is a base64-encoded UTF-8 string holding JSON with the encryption context key-value pairs.
parameters.name: x-amz-server-side-encryption-context

put.description:
Uploads a part in a multipart upload.

Note: After you initiate multipart upload and upload one or more parts, you must either complete or abort multipart upload in order to stop getting charged for storage of the uploaded parts. Only after you either complete or abort multipart upload, Amazon S3 frees up the parts storage and stops charging you for the parts storage.

parameters.description: Name of the bucket to which the multipart upload was initiated.
parameters.name: Bucket

parameters.description: Size of the body in bytes. This parameter is useful when the size of the body cannot be determined automatically.
parameters.name: Content-Length

parameters.description: The base64-encoded 128-bit MD5 digest of the part data. This parameter is auto-populated when using the command from the CLI. This parameted is required if object lock parameters are specified.
parameters.name: Content-MD5

parameters.description: Object key for which the multipart upload was initiated.
parameters.name: Key

parameters.description: Part number of part being uploaded. This is a positive integer between 1 and 10,000.
parameters.name: partNumber

parameters.description: Upload ID identifying the multipart upload whose part is being uploaded.
parameters.name: uploadId

parameters.description: Specifies the algorithm to use to when encrypting the object (e.g., AES256).
parameters.name: x-amz-server-side-encryption-customer-algorithm

parameters.description: Specifies the customer-provided encryption key for Amazon S3 to use in encrypting data. This value is used to store the object and then it is discarded; Amazon does not store the encryption key. The key must be appropriate for use with the algorithm specified in the x-amz-server-side​-encryption​-customer-algorithm header. This must be the same encryption key specified in the initiate multipart upload request.
parameters.name: x-amz-server-side-encryption-customer-key

parameters.description: Specifies the 128-bit MD5 digest of the encryption key according to RFC 1321. Amazon S3 uses this header for a message integrity check to ensure the encryption key was transmitted without error.
parameters.name: x-amz-server-side-encryption-customer-key-MD5

parameters.description: Confirms that the requester knows that she or he will be charged for the request. Bucket owners need not specify this parameter in their requests. post.description: This operation filters the contents of an Amazon S3 object based on a simple Structured Query Language (SQL) statement. In the request, along with the SQL expression, you must also specify a data serialization format (JSON or CSV) of the object. Amazon S3 uses this to parse object data into records, and returns only records that match the specified SQL expression. You must also specify the data serialization format for the response.

parameters.description: The S3 bucket.
parameters.name: Bucket

parameters.description: The object key.
parameters.name: Key

parameters.description: The SSE Algorithm used to encrypt the object. For more information, see Server-Side Encryption (Using Customer-Provided Encryption Keys.
parameters.name: x-amz-server-side-encryption-customer-algorithm

parameters.description: The SSE Customer Key. For more information, see Server-Side Encryption (Using Customer-Provided Encryption Keys.
parameters.name: x-amz-server-side-encryption-customer-key

parameters.description: The SSE Customer Key MD5. For more information, see Server-Side Encryption (Using Customer-Provided Encryption Keys.
parameters.name: x-amz-server-side-encryption-customer-key-MD5

Expression.description: The expression that is used to query the object.

ExpressionType.description: The type of the provided expression (for example., SQL).

InputSerialization.description: Describes the serialization format of the object.

OutputSerialization.description: Describes how results of the Select job are serialized.

delete.description:
Aborts a multipart upload.

To verify that all parts have been removed, so you don't get charged for the part storage, you should call the List Parts operation and ensure the parts list is empty.

Note: After you initiate multipart upload and upload one or more parts, you must either complete or abort multipart upload in order to stop getting charged for storage of the uploaded parts. x-amz-meta-.description: A map of metadata to store with the object in S3.

AccessControlPolicy.description: Contains the elements that set the ACL permissions for an object per grantee.

AbortIncompleteMultipartUpload.description: Specifies the days since the initiation of an incomplete multipart upload that Amazon S3 will wait before permanently removing all parts of the upload. For more information, see Aborting Incomplete Multipart Uploads Using a Bucket Lifecycle Policy in the Amazon Simple Storage Service Developer Guide.

AccelerateConfiguration.description: Configures the transfer acceleration state for an Amazon S3 bucket. For more information, see Amazon S3 Transfer Acceleration in the Amazon Simple Storage Service Developer Guide.

AccessControlPolicy.description: Contains the elements that set the ACL permissions for an object per grantee.

AccessControlTranslation.description: A container for information about access control for replicas.

AnalyticsAndOperator.description: A conjunction (logical AND) of predicates, which is used in evaluating a metrics filter. The operator must have at least two predicates in any combination, and an object must match all of the predicates for the filter to apply.

AnalyticsConfiguration.description:
Specifies the configuration and any analyses for the analytics filter of an Amazon S3 bucket.

For more information, see GET Bucket analytics in the Amazon Simple Storage Service API Reference.

AnalyticsExportDestination.description: Where to publish the analytics results.

BucketLifecycleConfiguration.description: Specifies the lifecycle configuration for objects in an Amazon S3 bucket. For more information, see Object Lifecycle Management in the Amazon Simple Storage Service Developer Guide.

CORSConfiguration.description: Describes the cross-origin access configuration for objects in an Amazon S3 bucket. For more information, see Enabling Cross-Origin Resource Sharing in the Amazon Simple Storage Service Developer Guide.

CORSRule.description: Specifies a cross-origin access rule for an Amazon S3 bucket.

CSVInput.description: Describes how a CSV-formatted input object is formatted.

CSVOutput.description: Describes how CSV-formatted results are formatted.

Condition.description: Specifies a condition that must be met for a redirect to apply.

DefaultRetention.description: The container element for specifying the default object lock retention settings for new objects placed in the specified bucket.

DeleteMarkerReplication.description: Specifies whether Amazon S3 should replicate delete makers.

Destination.description: Specifies information about where to publish analysis or configuration results for an Amazon S3 bucket.

EncodingType.description: Requests Amazon S3 to encode the object keys in the response and specifies the encoding method to use. An object key may contain any Unicode character; however, XML 1.0 parser cannot parse some characters, such as characters with an ASCII value from 0 to 10. For characters that are not supported in XML 1.0, you can add this parameter to request that Amazon S3 encode the keys in the response.

Encryption.description: Describes the server-side encryption that will be applied to the restore results.

EncryptionConfiguration.description: Specifies encryption-related information for an Amazon S3 bucket that is a destination for replicated objects.

Event.description: The bucket event for which to send notifications.

FilterRule.description: Specifies the Amazon S3 object key name to filter on and whether to filter on the suffix or prefix of the key name.

FilterRuleList.description: A list of containers for the key value pair that defines the criteria for the filter rule.

example.Policy: {"Version":"2008-10-17","Id":"LogPolicy","Statement":[{"Sid":"Enables the log delivery group to publish logs to your bucket ","Effect":"Allow","Principal":{"AWS":"111122223333"},"Action":["s3:GetBucketAcl","s3:GetObjectAcl","s3:PutObject"],"Resource":["arn:aws:s3:::policytest1/*","arn:aws:s3:::policytest1"]}]}

InputSerialization.description: Describes the serialization format of the object.

InventoryConfiguration.description: Specifies the inventory configuration for an Amazon S3 bucket. For more information, see GET Bucket inventory in the Amazon Simple Storage Service API Reference.

InventoryEncryption.description: Contains the type of server-side encryption used to encrypt the inventory results.

LambdaFunctionConfiguration.description: A container for specifying the configuration for AWS Lambda notifications.

LifecycleRuleAndOperator.description: This is used in a Lifecycle Rule Filter to apply a logical AND to two or more predicates. The Lifecycle Rule will apply to any object matching all of the predicates configured inside the And operator.

LifecycleRuleFilter.description: The Filter is used to identify objects that a Lifecycle Rule applies to. A Filter must have exactly one of Prefix, Tag, or And specified.

LoggingEnabled.description: Describes where logs are stored and the prefix that Amazon S3 assigns to all log object keys for a bucket. For more information, see PUT Bucket logging in the Amazon Simple Storage Service API Reference.

MetadataEntry.description: A metadata key-value pair to store with an object.

MetricsConfiguration.description: Specifies a metrics configuration for the CloudWatch request metrics (specified by the metrics configuration ID) from an Amazon S3 bucket. If you're updating an existing metrics configuration, note that this is a full replacement of the existing metrics configuration. If you don't include the elements you want to keep, they are erased. For more information, see PUT Bucket metrics in the Amazon Simple Storage Service API Reference.

NoncurrentVersionExpiration.description: Specifies when noncurrent object versions expire. Upon expiration, Amazon S3 permanently deletes the noncurrent object versions. You set this lifecycle configuration action on a bucket that has versioning enabled (or suspended) to request that Amazon S3 delete noncurrent object versions at a specific period in the object's lifetime.

NoncurrentVersionTransition.description: Container for the transition rule that describes when noncurrent objects transition to the STANDARD_IA, ONEZONE_IA, INTELLIGENT_TIERING, GLACIER, or DEEP_ARCHIVE storage class. If your bucket is versioning-enabled (or versioning is suspended), you can set this action to request that Amazon S3 transition noncurrent object versions to the STANDARD_IA, ONEZONE_IA, INTELLIGENT_TIERING, GLACIER, or DEEP_ARCHIVE storage class at a specific period in the object's lifetime.

NotificationConfiguration.description: A container for specifying the notification configuration of the bucket. If this element is empty, notifications are turned off for the bucket.

NotificationConfigurationFilter.description: Specifies object key name filtering rules. For information about key name filtering, see Configuring Event Notifications in the Amazon Simple Storage Service Developer Guide.

NotificationId.description: An optional unique identifier for configurations in a notification configuration. If you don't provide one, Amazon S3 will assign an ID.

ObjectLockConfiguration.description: The container element for object lock configuration parameters.

ObjectLockLegalHold.description: A Legal Hold configuration for an object.

ObjectLockRetention.description: A Retention configuration for an object.

ObjectLockRule.description: The container element for an object lock rule.

OutputLocation.description: Describes the location where the restore job's output is stored.

OutputSerialization.description: Describes how results of the Select job are serialized.

PolicyStatus.description: The container element for a bucket's policy status.

PublicAccessBlockConfiguration.description: Specifies the Block Public Access configuration for an Amazon S3 bucket.

QueueConfiguration.description: Specifies the configuration for publishing messages to an Amazon Simple Queue Service (Amazon SQS) queue when Amazon S3 detects specified events.

Redirect.description: Specifies how requests are redirected. In the event of an error, you can specify a different error code to return.

RedirectAllRequestsTo.description: Specifies the redirect behavior of all requests to a website endpoint of an Amazon S3 bucket.

ReplicationConfiguration.description: A container for replication rules. You can add up to 1,000 rules. The maximum size of a replication configuration is 2 MB.

ReplicationRule.description: Specifies which Amazon S3 objects to replicate and where to store the replicas.

ReplicationRuleFilter.description: A filter that identifies the subset of objects to which the replication rule applies. A Filter must specify exactly one Prefix, Tag, or an And child element.

RequestCharged.description: If present, indicates that the requester was successfully charged for the request.

RequestPayer.description: Confirms that the requester knows that she or he will be charged for the request. Bucket owners need not specify this parameter in their requests. Documentation on downloading objects from requester pays buckets can be found at http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonS3/latest/dev/ObjectsinRequesterPaysBuckets.html

RoutingRule.description: Specifies the redirect behavior and when a redirect is applied.

Rule.description: Specifies lifecycle rules for an Amazon S3 bucket. For more information, see PUT Bucket lifecycle in the Amazon Simple Storage Service API Reference.

S3KeyFilter.description: A container for object key name prefix and suffix filtering rules.

S3Location.description: Describes an S3 location that will receive the results of the restore request.

SSEKMS.description: Specifies the use of SSE-KMS to encrypt delivered Inventory reports.

SSES3.description: Specifies the use of SSE-S3 to encrypt delivered Inventory reports.

SelectObjectContentRequest.description: Request to filter the contents of an Amazon S3 object based on a simple Structured Query Language (SQL) statement. In the request, along with the SQL expression, you must specify a data serialization format (JSON or CSV) of the object. Amazon S3 uses this to parse object data into records. It returns only records that match the specified SQL expression. You must also specify the data serialization format for the response. For more information, see S3Select API Documentation.

SelectParameters.description: Describes the parameters for Select job types.

ServerSideEncryptionByDefault.description: Describes the default server-side encryption to apply to new objects in the bucket. If a PUT Object request doesn't specify any server-side encryption, this default encryption will be applied. For more information, see PUT Bucket encryption in the Amazon Simple Storage Service API Reference.

ServerSideEncryptionRule.description: Specifies the default server-side encryption configuration.

SourceSelectionCriteria.description: A container that describes additional filters for identifying the source objects that you want to replicate. You can choose to enable or disable the replication of these objects. Currently, Amazon S3 supports only the filter that you can specify for objects created with server-side encryption using an AWS KMS-Managed Key (SSE-KMS).

SseKmsEncryptedObjects.description: A container for filter information for the selection of S3 objects encrypted with AWS KMS.

StorageClassAnalysis.description: Specifies data related to access patterns to be collected and made available to analyze the tradeoffs between different storage classes for an Amazon S3 bucket.

TopicConfiguration.description: A container for specifying the configuration for publication of messages to an Amazon Simple Notification Service (Amazon SNS) topic when Amazon S3 detects specified events.

Transition.description: Specifies when an object transitions to a specified storage class.

VersioningConfiguration.description: Describes the versioning state of an Amazon S3 bucket. For more information, see PUT Bucket versioning in the Amazon Simple Storage Service API Reference.

WebsiteConfiguration.description: Specifies website configuration parameters for an Amazon S3 bucket.
